title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, January 24, 1865
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife and describes the lonely life he and Freddy are leading. He expresses his frustration at a life separated from his family, and laments the four years they have been apart. He discusses running the hotel and a store in Staunton. He also sends several I.O.U.'s his wife can collect for her own use.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
